column5: Group of 14 fished out of Evergreen Lodge last week. The lodge is located in Ear Falls on the NW section of Lac Seul. Brent and Kathie are tremendous hosts and do a great job making sure all of your needs are met. One of the perks fishing out of Evergreen is that their boats have 2 live wells for minnows and run with 60 Yamaha's. We had 3 guys in our boat everyday and it's more than comfortable. Taking my 89 year old father was a true blessing. Mosquitos are horrible at night and for the first time I can remember, they were out during the day at we came back to the dock in the afternoon. Weather was cold and rainy 5 out of the 6 days. We caught fish in 15-25 foot of water. Biggest walleye was 26" (2) with a few in the 23-24" range. Had big numbers a couple days, all on jigs tipped with minnows. 2 days were extremely difficult, only boating 30-35 fish between the 3 of us. We made the trip up last year after the border opened and had 4 days of dream fishing. This year was a bit more difficult to locate them, but all in all, a great trip. Caught most of our fish in Steamboat. Same time same place next year and God willing, pops will be fishing with us at 90 years young.
Good for you bringing your father! We should be so lucky to have someone bring us to Canada when we're 89. Weather and bugs change every year, but it's always a good time. Thanks for the report.
Good to know. I'll add you to my list of potential crew members. Now I just have to remember where I put that list 15 years from now...
Put it in your tackle box,you'll see the list every year!!

Eck: Where's your Keikewabik report? Give us some substance for a change. I know I unloaded all the meaningful fish out of there 50-60 years ago, but did leave a few slicers for you. Let's hear about them.
I didn't catch any fish at keikewabik,,,maybe next week I will,going aug 10.
Thanks for the report! We are headed to Onaway Lodge on Lac Seul 8/26! Count down is on & can't wait!!! RBF üëç‚ù§Ô∏èüé£üá®üá¶üòé
